member.name: T:Lucene.Net.Linq.KeyConstraint
member.summary: Used in conjunction with .

member.name: F:Lucene.Net.Linq.KeyConstraint.None
member.summary:
EXPERT: this constraint may be used by clients when the client knows that there is definitely not a document with the same key already present in the index.
When is invoked, normally any pending updates and additions are preceding by deleting existing documents with the same to ensure that the key is unique.
This option is provided to improve performance by avoiding the delete-by-query step in the commit process.
If this option is used incorrectly, the index may be left in an undesirable state where multiple documents have the same key. It should be used with caution.

member.name: F:Lucene.Net.Linq.KeyConstraint.Unique
member.summary:
The default add behavior of the session . Using this value on has the same result of .
In this mode, invoking will execute a delete query for each unique that corresponds to an updated or added item.

member.name: T:Lucene.Net.Linq.LuceneDataProviderSettings
member.summary: Holds configuration settings that specify how the library behaves.

summary.para: This setting controls whether searches performed on the IndexSearcher will include a that ensures that only documents that match (or ) and have a non-blank field for each property that has (or ).

When enabled, entities of differing types can be safely stored in the same index. However, including this filter can severely reduce query execution performance. This setting is enabled by default to preserve backwards compatibility but may be disabled by default in a future release to provide better performance as the default case.

member.name: P:Lucene.Net.Linq.LuceneDataProviderSettings.DeletionPolicy
member.summary: Specifies the of the . Default: .

member.summary: Specifies the RAM buffer size of the in megabytes. Default: 16.0 (from .

member.name: M:Lucene.Net.Linq.LuceneDataProvider.RegisterCacheWarmingCallback``1(System.Action{System.Linq.IQueryable{``0}},Lucene.Net.Linq.ObjectLookup{``0},Lucene.Net.Linq.Mapping.IDocumentMapper{``0})
member.summary:
Registers a callback to be invoked when a new IndexSearcher is being initialized. This method allows an IndexSearcher to be "warmed up" by executing one or more queries before the instance becomes visible on other threads.
While callbacks are being executed, other threads will continue to use the previous instance of IndexSearcher if this is not the first instance being initialized.
If this is the first instance, other threads will block until all callbacks complete.

member.summary: Retrieves the instance of IndexWriter that will be used by all sessions created by this instance. If the current writer has been disposed or a rollback occurred, a new instance will be created, unless the instance was passed in as a constructor parameter.

member.summary: Delegate used by to create instances of objects that do not have public default constructors.
member.typeparam: The type of object s will be mapped onto.

member.name: T:Lucene.Net.Linq.ObjectLookup`1
member.summary: Delegate used by to create or reuse instances of objects for advanced clients that may wish to provide caching.
member.typeparam: The type of object s will be mapped onto.

member.name: T:Lucene.Net.Linq.LuceneMethods
member.summary: Contains custom extensions to LINQ for integrating with Lucene.Net.

member.name: M:Lucene.Net.Linq.LuceneMethods.AnyField``1(``0)
member.summary: Expression to be used in a LINQ where clauses to search for documents where any field matches a given pattern.

member.name: M:Lucene.Net.Linq.LuceneMethods.Boost``1(``0,System.Single)
member.summary: Applies a boost to a property in a where clause.

member.name: M:Lucene.Net.Linq.LuceneMethods.Boost``1(System.Linq.IQueryable{``0},System.Func{``0,System.Single})
member.summary: Applies a custom boost function to customize query scoring. When multiple boost functions are added by calling this method more than once, the return values from each function are multiplied to yield a final result. Warning: this method will cause each document that matches the query to be converted to an instance of in order for the score to be computed, significantly degrading performance.

member.name: M:Lucene.Net.Linq.LuceneMethods.BoostInternal``1(System.Linq.IQueryable{``0},System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``0,System.Single}})
member.summary: Applies a custom boost function to customize query scoring. When multiple boost functions are added by calling this method more than once, the return values from each function are multiplied to yield a final result.

member.name: M:Lucene.Net.Linq.LuceneMethods.Fuzzy(System.Boolean,System.Single)
member.summary: Enables fuzzy matching on the preceeding query clause so that similar but not identical terms are matched.

member.name: M:Lucene.Net.Linq.LuceneMethods.CaptureStatistics``1(System.Linq.IQueryable{``0},System.Action{Lucene.Net.Linq.LuceneQueryStatistics})
member.summary: Registers a callback to be invoked when the query is executed to provide access to metadata including total hits and execution time.

member.name: M:Lucene.Net.Linq.LuceneMethods.Where``1(System.Linq.IQueryable{``0},Lucene.Net.Search.Query)
member.summary: Applies the provided Query. Enables queries to be constructed from outside of LINQ to be executed as part of a LINQ query.

member.name: M:Lucene.Net.Linq.LuceneMethods.Score``1(``0)
member.summary: Expression to be used in a LINQ orderby clause to sort results by score. Note: since score is a decimal based weight, ordering by score normally results in additional orderby clauses having no effect.

member.name: M:Lucene.Net.Linq.LuceneMethods.AllowSpecialCharacters``1(``0)
member.summary:
Instructs the query parser that a given query pattern in a LINQ where clause should not have special characters (such as *) escaped.
Disabling escaping allows prefix, wildcard, phrase and range queries to be parsed from the instead of treating it as a verbatim search term.

member.name: M:Lucene.Net.Linq.Mapping.ReflectionFieldMapper`1.TryParseKeywordContainingWhitespace(System.String,Lucene.Net.Search.Query@)
member.summary: Attempt to determine if a given query pattern contains whitespace and the analyzer does not tokenize on whitespace. This is a work-around for cases when QueryParser would split a keyword that contains whitespace into multiple tokens.

member.name: M:Lucene.Net.Linq.Mapping.ReflectionFieldMapper`1.IsWildcardPattern(System.String)
member.summary: Determine if a (potentially escaped) pattern contains any non-escaped wildcard characters such as * or ?.

member.name: M:Lucene.Net.Linq.Mapping.ReflectionFieldMapper`1.Unescape(System.String)
member.summary: Remove escape characters from a pattern. This method is called when a is being created without using .

member.name: T:Lucene.Net.Linq.Mapping.BaseFieldAttribute
member.summary: Base attribute for customizing how properties are stored and indexed.

member.name: P:Lucene.Net.Linq.Mapping.BaseFieldAttribute.Field
member.summary: Specifies the name of the backing field that the property value will be mapped to. When not specified, defaults to the name of the property being decorated by this attribute.

member.name: P:Lucene.Net.Linq.Mapping.BaseFieldAttribute.Store
member.summary: Set to true to store value in index for later retrieval, or false if the field should only be indexed.

member.name: P:Lucene.Net.Linq.Mapping.BaseFieldAttribute.Converter
member.summary: Provides a custom TypeConverter implementation that can convert the property type to and from strings so they can be stored and indexed by Lucene.Net.

member.name: P:Lucene.Net.Linq.Mapping.BaseFieldAttribute.Key
member.summary:
Specifies that the property value, combined with any other properties that also specify Key = true, represents a unique primary key to the document.
Key fields are used to replace or delete documents.

member.name: P:Lucene.Net.Linq.Mapping.BaseFieldAttribute.Boost
member.summary: Specifies a boost to apply when a document is being analyzed during indexing. Defaults to 1.0f.

member.name: T:Lucene.Net.Linq.Mapping.FieldAttribute
member.summary: Customizes how a property is converted to a field as well as storage and indexing options.

member.name: M:Lucene.Net.Linq.Mapping.FieldAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor

member.name: M:Lucene.Net.Linq.Mapping.FieldAttribute.#ctor(Lucene.Net.Linq.Mapping.IndexMode)
member.param: How the field should be indexed for searching and sorting.

member.name: M:Lucene.Net.Linq.Mapping.FieldAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.param: Backing field used to store data in Lucene index.

member.name: M:Lucene.Net.Linq.Mapping.FieldAttribute.#ctor(System.String,Lucene.Net.Linq.Mapping.IndexMode)
member.param: Backing field used to store data in Lucene index.
How the field should be indexed for searching and sorting.

member.name: P:Lucene.Net.Linq.Mapping.FieldAttribute.IndexMode
member.summary: How the field should be indexed for searching and sorting.

member.name: P:Lucene.Net.Linq.Mapping.FieldAttribute.Format
member.summary: Overrides default format pattern to use when converting ValueType to string. If both Format and Converter are specified, Converter will take precedence and Format will be ignored.

member.name: P:Lucene.Net.Linq.Mapping.FieldAttribute.CaseSensitive
member.summary: When true, causes to be set to false to prevent wildcard queries like Foo* from being converted to lowercase.

member.name: P:Lucene.Net.Linq.Mapping.FieldAttribute.DefaultParserOperator
member.summary: Gets or sets the default parser operator.

member.name: P:Lucene.Net.Linq.Mapping.FieldAttribute.Analyzer
member.summary:
When set, supplies a custom analyzer for this field. The analyzer type must have either a parameterless public constructor, or a public constructor that accepts a argument.
When an external Analyzer is provided on methods it will override this setting.

member.name: P:Lucene.Net.Linq.Mapping.FieldAttribute.TermVector
member.summary: Maps to

member.name: P:Lucene.Net.Linq.Mapping.FieldAttribute.NativeSort
member.summary: When true and the property implements and/or , instructs the mapping engine to use instead of converting each field and using . This is a performance enhancement in cases where the string representation of a complex type is alphanumerically sortable.

member.name: T:Lucene.Net.Linq.Mapping.NumericFieldAttribute
member.summary: Maps a , or any type that can be converted to , , , or to a that will be indexed as a trie structure to enable more efficient range filtering and sorting.

member.name: M:Lucene.Net.Linq.Mapping.NumericFieldAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor

member.name: M:Lucene.Net.Linq.Mapping.NumericFieldAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.param: Backing field used to store data in Lucene index.

member.name: T:Lucene.Net.Linq.Mapping.IgnoreFieldAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that a public property should be ignored by the Lucene.Net.Linq mapping engine when converting objects to Documents and vice-versa.

member.name: T:Lucene.Net.Linq.Mapping.QueryScoreAttribute
member.summary: When set on a property, the property will be set with the score (relevance) of the document based on the queries and boost settings.

member.name: T:Lucene.Net.Linq.Mapping.DocumentBoostAttribute
member.summary: When set on a property, the document boost will be set with the property value

member.name: T:Lucene.Net.Linq.Mapping.DocumentKeyAttribute
member.summary:
When set on a class, defines a fixed-value key that will always be used when querying for objects of this type or deleting and replacing documents with matching keys.
This attribute enables multiple object types to be stored in the same index by ensuring that unrelated documents of other types will not be returned when querying.

member.name: P:Lucene.Net.Linq.Mapping.DocumentKeyAttribute.FieldName
member.summary: The field name that will be queried.

member.name: P:Lucene.Net.Linq.Mapping.DocumentKeyAttribute.Value
member.summary: The constant value that will be queried.

member.name: T:Lucene.Net.Linq.Transformation.TreeVisitors.BooleanBinaryToQueryPredicateExpressionTreeVisitor
member.summary: Replaces boolean binary expressions like [LuceneQueryPredicateExpression](+field:query) == false to [LuceneQueryPredicateExpression](-field:query)

member.name: T:Lucene.Net.Linq.Transformation.TreeVisitors.ExternallyProvidedQueryExpressionTreeVisitor
member.summary: Replaces method calls like Matches with query expressions.

member.name: T:Lucene.Net.Linq.Transformation.TreeVisitors.NoOpConvertExpressionRemovingVisitor
member.summary: Replaces expressions like (bool)(Constant(bool?)) with Constant(bool?).

member.name: T:Lucene.Net.Linq.Transformation.TreeVisitors.SubQueryContainsTreeVisitor
member.summary: Replaces subqueries like {[doc].Tags => Contains("c")} with BinaryExpressions like ([doc].Tags == "c").

member.name: T:Lucene.Net.Linq.Transformation.TreeVisitors.NoOpConditionRemovingTreeVisitor
member.summary: Converts pointless BinaryExpressions like "True AndAlso Expression" or "False OrElse Expression" to take only the right side. Applies recursively to collapse deeply nested pointless expressions.

member.name: T:Lucene.Net.Linq.Transformation.QueryModelTransformer
member.summary: Transforms various expressions in a QueryModel instance to make it easier to convert into a Lucene Query.

member.name: T:Lucene.Net.Linq.Transformation.TreeVisitors.CompareCallToLuceneQueryPredicateExpressionTreeVisitor
member.summary: Replaces supported method calls like string.Compare([LuceneQueryFieldExpression], "abc") > 0 to LuceneQueryPredicateExpression

member.name: T:Lucene.Net.Linq.Transformation.TreeVisitors.ConcatToCompositeOrderingExpressionTreeVisitor
member.summary: Replaces method calls like string.Concat([LuceneQueryFieldExpression], [LuceneQueryFieldExpression]) to LuceneCompositeOrderingExpression

member.name: T:Lucene.Net.Linq.Transformation.TreeVisitors.MethodCallToLuceneQueryPredicateExpressionTreeVisitor
member.summary: Replaces supported method calls like [LuceneQueryFieldExpression].StartsWith("foo") with a LuceneQueryPredicateExpression like [LuceneQueryPredicateExpression](+Field:foo*)

member.name: T:Lucene.Net.Linq.Transformation.TreeVisitors.NoOpMethodCallRemovingTreeVisitor
member.summary: Removes method calls like string.ToLower() that have no effect on a query due to case sensitivity in Lucene being configured elsewhere by the Analyzer.

member.name: T:Lucene.Net.Linq.Transformation.TreeVisitors.NullSafetyConditionRemovingTreeVisitor
member.summary: Locates expressions like IFF(x != null, x, null) and converts them to x. When combined with a null-safe ToLower operation like IFF(x != null, x.ToLower(), null) is simplified to x.

member.name: T:Lucene.Net.Linq.Transformation.TreeVisitors.QuerySourceReferencePropertyTransformingTreeVisitor
member.summary: Replaces MemberExpression instances like [QuerySourceReferenceExpression].PropertyName with

member.name: M:Lucene.Net.Linq.Util.NumericRangeUtils.ToNumericFieldValue(System.ValueType)
member.summary: Converts supported value types such as DateTime to an underlying ValueType that is supported by .

member.name: M:Lucene.Net.Linq.Util.NumericRangeUtils.ForceDisableOmitNorms(Lucene.Net.Documents.NumericField)
member.summary: See https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LUCENENET-519. uses and does not allow alternative indexing methods to be used. This prevents boost from being applied when a document is being indexed.
